body_raw: In investigating approaches to Fermat's Last Theorem I came across the following and I can't figure out where I am going wrong.  Any input would be greatly appreciated. We want to show that $a^n + b^n = c^n$ cannot hold for odd $n>1$ and pairwise relatively prime $a$, $b$, and $c$.
